lines.text: Run, insect. Run and tell those you will, what you will. Tell them there is something loose in their city which feeds on wishes. But tell them quickly, while you still have a soul.
Listen to their screams, child, listen to the music of their agony.
[first lines]
[first title card]

Once, in a time before time, God breathed life into the universe. And the light gave birth to Angels. And the earth gave birth to Man. And the fire gave birth to the Djinn, creatures condemned to dwell in the void between the worlds. One who wakes a Djinn will be given three wishes. Upon the granting of the third, the unholy legions of the Djinn will be freed to rule the earth. Fear one thing in all there is... FEAR THE DJINN.
A djinn? A genie?

Now hold on a minute. Forget what our culture has made of the Djinn. Forget Barbara Eden. Forget Robin Williams. To the people of ancient Arabia, the Djinn was neither cute not funny. It was something else entirely. It was the face of fear itself.
What happens if I wished you dead?
Why, how remarkably original of you, Alexandra. I'll tell you what. I'll give you one free wish. A sample. Just to get you in the spirit of the game.
All right. I want you to destroy yourself. Blow your brains out. Right now
Very well.
[He picks up a gun, presses it under his chin, and pulls the trigger, blowing off the top of his head]

[wound heals instantly, surprising Alexandra]
That which is eternal cannot die. But if it's any consolation sweet Alex, THAT HURT LIKE HELL!

The cry of the abandoned child. The whimper of the whipped beast. I am the face that stares back at you from the shadows of your mirror. The hollowness at the heart of all your hopes, Alexandra. I AM DESPAIR.
You left customers in there. That's not a very good way to run a business.
Don't you tell me how to run my business, you're a fucking bum!
Well, you don't tell me how to run my life! You're a fucking prick! I'll talk to whoever I want to! You don't own this fucking sidewalk!
You wanna know something? I do own this fuckin' sidewalk. You wanna know why? Cause I pay fuckin' taxes!
Fuck you!
No, fuck you!
I hope you die, you sack of shit. I hope you die, and I hope you float down the gutter, so I can fuckin' piss on you!
[the Pharmacist loses interest and leaves]
You big, bald-headed baboon! Miscomplected afterbirth of a Chinese gang-banger! Educated idiot!
If there's no hope, no magic, I'll have to rely on myself.

[as Wendy]
Match wits with a creature older than time? Match wits with a prince of the dark dominions? Pit your tiny twentieth century mind against one who walked the spaces between the worlds, and trod the wings of angels beneath his conquering feet? Alexandra, you're a delight! Really, you are.
My God!
Not yet, human. Soon... very soon I will be.
Do you have any idea how frustrating it is to have unlimited power, and only be able to use it when some worm asks you for something?
No, I can't say that I do. I can't say that I give a shit, either.
My patience wears thin.
What are you going to do, kill me? Where's your third wish then?
I don't need you dead, Alexandra. I just need you to wish you were.
Where's Wendy?
Bedroom. But I wouldn't go in there if I were you. Messy. I needed her face.
You killed her.
Actually, I can't kill anyone. Not unless they wish me to. Your research should have told you that.
She didn't wish to be dead, you lying sack of shit!

I showed her my true face. Her reaction wasn't very flattering. As a matter of fact, she got downright hysterical! I merely asked if she wished to be released from her fear. You're a dangerous person to know, Alexandra. Your scientist friend, your boss, the policeman, Wendy. By the by-where is that tasty little sister of yours today?
[licks upper lip slowly]
Going my way?
So, how do you like me so far?
We have unfinished business.
It's gonna stay unfinished!
Step aside, doorman.
Doorman? The name is Valentine. Johnny Valentine. You'd better remember when they ask you how you lost your eye!
I claim that which is owed.
Does the word dumbass mean anything to you?
[after encasing Johnny Valentine in a steel-and-glass box filled with water, with Valentine in a straitjacket]
Houdini did it in two and a half minutes.
[calmly walks up the steps and into Beaumont's party]
[last lines]
So what are we doing tonight?
'We?'
Oh, what's the matter, Josh? Are you afraid of the complications?
Um...
You know what? I think this could help.
[puts hat on Josh's head]
Does that help?
...Yeah. Yeah, where are we going tonight?
Dinner and movie?
With me?
Yeah.
Yeah, yeah. I was thinking more about, um... about hot dogs and a ball game.

[laughs, kisses Josh]
Yeah.
Um, are you... Are you alright?
[winks]
Alex?

[referring to Raymond Beaumont]
What an insufferable prick that man is. Still, it's not your problem. Unless, of course, you're stupid enough to be working for him.

[shaking her head]
No.
Or sleeping with him.

[slightly disgusted]
No.
Oh good. Well, that establishes your discerning good taste.
[turns her attention to something else, then addresses Alex without looking at her]
Uh-huh. What can I do for you?

[assertively]
Absolutely nothing at all until I can get your full attention.

[turns and stares at her, Alex stares right back]
I like you.
If you harm Shannon, I'll kill you.

[showing Alexandra his Djinn form]
Spare me child. Behold my true face

[scared]
Oh my God.
Yes. The shit just... hit the fan, didn't it?
Why don't you go to bed? I don't want you to worry.
Can you can the big sister act for one night?

[referring to the curses the homeless man shouted]
What would you do to have them come true?
Cigarette and a handshake's about all I got, pal.
Not quite. You have a soul.
That I'd trade for a shower and a jug of jack.
Then the death of your enemy you would consider a bargain?

[about the fire opal]
Hey. Clegg gave me a couple hundred. Did I get fucked?

[walking away]
Royally!
Where is Alexandra?
Uh, well I'm sorry, but I don't really feel comfortable telling you.
What would make you comfortable, Nick? Name it.
What's my limit?
Your imagination.
[after the end credits roll]
Careful what you wish for.
